result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

INITIAL SCHEDULING ORDER
Status conference on January 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Activity: Initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:24 PM Defendant Donavon Scott Maki in court in custody at the Rock County Jail by video with attorney Shanna Knueppel.  David Zarwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified.  Signature bond set of $400.00  with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victim A.H., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Except for One time visit to residence with a uniformed officer to retrieve immediate personal belongings. May have contact with A.H. Only through 3rd party for child visitation purposes. Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.
